p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false; break-before: page;

div.p: Letter not found. This is the same text asM70-06-04, but based on amisunderstandingI think, BUT location details differ

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: If it was the Ass Commissioner asking, thenMwould not be the author.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: Seems to me that there is something odd in the reading of the register.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: I think registers will need to be looked at to make sense of who was writing to whom about Fergusonwho was responsible to M at the Gardens at this stage.Was M writing to Hodgkinson to get approval? Was Ferguson bypassing M, or what??
No. 6214, vol. 1870 V, VPRS 1168/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

[Asst Commr of Lands & Survey asks permission for Mr Ferguson
William Ferguson.
to visit Hamilton & Penshurst in reference to preservation of native trees growing there]
This letter was referred back to M on 13 June 1870, minuted: 'The C. S. approves'.
